location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.430 of 1855 from Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter with notes, relating to the circumstances surrounding Jones’s transfer from his role as Government Agent and Consul-General at Baghdad, to Resident at Bushire. The enclosure is a copy of a letter (folio 184) from Captain Arnold Kemball, Consul-General at Baghdad to Jones, dated 18 October 1855, itself enclosing a copy of a letter (folio 184v) from the Director General to Kemball, dated 27 August 1855. This letter confirms Jones’s appointment to the position of Agent to the Land Transport Corps in Turkish Arabia, at around the same time as Jones was transferred to Bushire.
